data.heading: Scope
data.text: This document defines requirements that are common to ITS stations units.

data.heading: Normative references
data.text:
For the purposes of this document, the terms and definitions given in ISO/TS 14812 apply.

ISO and IEC maintain terminology databases for use in standardization at the following addresses:

•   ISO Online browsing platform: available at https://www.iso.org/obp

•   IEC Electropedia: available at https://www.electropedia.org

attributesChanged.text: This document does not place requirements on external interfaces, but it does identify the external interfaces that are expected to exist per the ConOps. In these cases, it uses a "should" statement rather than a "shall" statement.

children.heading: Open specification
children.text: The ITS-SU shall support the applicable, publicly available interface specification(s) defined by the relevant regional authority.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall support the publicly available interface specification defined by the regional authority for the intended area of distribution.
The ITS station shall support the publicly available interface specification(s) defined by the regional authority for the intended area of distribution.
The ITS station shall support the publicly available interface specification(s) defined by the relevant regional authority.
The ITS-SU shall support the publicly available interface specification(s) defined by the relevant regional authority.

children.heading: Resource management
children.text:
The ITS-SU shall manage its resources to ensure service resiliency.

NOTE: Resources include processing power, memory, network connectivity, storage space, etc.

attributesChanged.text:
The METR distribution system shall manage its resources to ensure service resiliency.

NOTE: Resources include processing power, memory, network connectivity, storage space, etc.

The ITS station shall manage its resources to ensure service resiliency.

NOTE: Resources include processing power, memory, network connectivity, storage space, etc.
general system health and diagnostics

children.heading: Platform management
children.text:
The ITS-SU shall allow for authorized remote systems to manage its operational platform to ensure expected operations.

EXAMPLE   A traffic management centre acting as a translator can reboot the unix platform of one of its roadside devices.

attributesChanged.text:
The ITS-SU shall allow for authorized remote systems to manage its operational platform to ensure expected operations.

EXAMPLE   A traffic management centre acting as a translator can reboot the unix platform.

children.heading: Application management
children.text:
The ITS-SU shall allow for authorized remote systems to manage operations of installed application software to ensure expected operations.

EXAMPLE   A traffic management centre acting as a translator can control the broadcast of ad-hoc rules via roadside equipment.

attributesChanged.text:
The METR translation system shall manage the METR application running on field distribution systems to ensure expected operations of disseminating rules.

NOTE: This is especially true for ad-hoc rules.

EXAMPLE   A traffic management centre acting as a translator can control the broadcast of ad-hoc rules via roadside equipment.

The ITS-SU shall allow for authorized remote systems to manage its operation to ensure expected operations.

EXAMPLE   A traffic management centre acting as a translator can control the broadcast of ad-hoc rules via roadside equipment.

children.heading: Updates and patches
children.text: The ITS-SU shall manage the installation of upgrades and patches in a manner that does not unduly disrupt its continuous provision of services.

attributesChanged.text: The METR translation system shall manage the installation of upgrades and patches in a manner that does not disrupt its continuous provision of services.
The ITS-SU shall manage the installation of upgrades and patches in a manner that does not disrupt its continuous provision of services.

children.heading: Security
children.text:
The ITS-SU shall comply with the relevant security policies as defined by the CCMS.

NOTE: The security policies often include policies for enrolment, authorization, misbehaviour reporting, and credentials revocation.

attributesChanged.text:
The METR distribution system shall comply with the relevant security policies as defined by the CCMS.

NOTE: The security policies often include policies for enrollment, authorization, misbehaviour reporting, and credentials revocation.

The ITS station shall comply with the relevant security policies as defined by the CCMS.

NOTE: The security policies often include policies for enrollment, authorization, misbehaviour reporting, and credentials revocation.

The ITS-SU shall comply with the relevant security policies as defined by the CCMS.

NOTE: The security policies often include policies for enrollment, authorization, misbehaviour reporting, and credentials revocation.

children.heading: Ensure authenticated communications
children.text: The ITS-SU shall ensure that all communications received are authenticated prior to further processing.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall ensure that all communications received are authenticated prior to further processing.

children.heading: Confidential information
children.text: The ITS-SU shall maintain the confidentiality of all personally identifiable information (PII) by:

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall maintain the confidentiality of all information related to METR users and operators by:
The ITS station shall maintain the confidentiality of all personally identifiable information (PII) by:

children.text: encrypting any data exchanged across a public network according to regional policies;
children.title: Encryption

children.text: minimizing the amount of PII that it stores; and
children.title: Minimizing PII

attributesChanged.text: minimizing the amount of user and operator data it stores; and
minimizing the amount of personally identifiable information that it stores; and

children.text: openly publishing what it uses PII for.
children.title: Transparency

attributesChanged.text: openly publishing what it uses user and operator data for.

children.heading: Maintain privacy
children.text: The ITS-SU shall only use data for the purposes identified in the ITS-SU's terms of service statement.

children.heading: Access controls
children.text: The ITS-SU shall only allow access to data for which valid authorization credentials with appropriate permissions are provided.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall only allow operators to access data to which they are authorized.
The ITS station shall only allow access to data for which authorization credentials are provided.
The ITS station shall only allow access to data for which valid authorization credentials are provided.
The ITS-SU shall only allow access to data for which valid authorization credentials are provided.

children.heading: Maintain configuration log
children.text:
The ITS-SU shall log a timestamped record for each change to its configuration.

NOTE: This includes changes to the configuration of the ITS-SU and the configuration of any ITS application process installed on the ITS-SU.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall maintain timestamped records of all changes to rule information and system configurations.
The ITS station shall log a timestamped record of each change to its application data and system configuration.

children.heading: Maintain activity log
children.text: The ITS-SU shall log a timestamped record for each data exchange with an external entity.

attributesChanged.heading: Maintain change log
attributesChanged.text: The ITS station shall log a timestamped record of each change to its application data and system configuration.
The ITS station shall log a timestamped record for each data exchange with an external entity.

children.heading: Response requirement
children.text: The ITS-SU shall have a response time of no more than stationResponseTime for any data exchange, unless otherwise stated.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall have a response time of no more than metrDistributionResponseTime for any data exchange.
The ITS station shall have a response time of no more than stationResponseTime for any data exchange, unless otherwise stated.

children.heading: Response time definition
children.text: For a request-response exchange, the response time is defined as the time from the receipt of the last byte of a request to the start of the transmission of the first byte of the response (when access is allowed by lower layers). For a publication to a subscription or broadcast, the response time is defined as the time from the information first becoming valid for publication to the respective user to the start of the transmission of the first byte of the transmission (when access is allowed by lower layers). The length of the transmission will be dependent upon the amount of data that needs to be transferred and the effective data rate of transfer.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall obtain relevant policies for enrollment, authorization, misbehaviour reporting, and credentials revocation.
The ITS station shall obtain relevant policies for enrollment, authorization, misbehaviour reporting, and credentials revocation from the CCMS.

children.heading: Obtain policies
children.text: The ITS-SU shall obtain the following relevant policies from the CCMS:

attributesChanged.text: The ITS station shall obtain relevant policies for enrollment, authorization, misbehaviour reporting, and credentials revocation from the CCMS.
The ITS station shall obtain the following relevant policies from the CCMS:

children.text: enrollment

attributesChanged.text: enrollment

children.text: authorization
misbehaviour reporting
credentials revocation

children.heading: Comply with policies
children.text: The ITS-SU shall comply with the security policies obtained from the CCMS.

attributesChanged.text:
The METR distribution system shall implement the relevant authorization policies.

EXAMPLE  Data is rejected if not from authorized source with required permissions

The ITS station shall comply with the authorization policies .

EXAMPLE  Data is rejected if not from authorized source with required permissions
The ITS station shall comply with the security policies obtained from the CCMS.

children.heading: Enrollment credentials
children.text: The ITS-SU shall obtain long-term security credentials that demonstrate its trustworthiness.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall obtain long-term security credentials that demonstrate its trustworthiness.
The ITS station shall obtain long-term security credentials that demonstrate its trustworthiness.

children.heading: Security credential revocations
children.text: The ITS-SU shall reject the security credentials for any certificate whose trust has been revoked by the CCMS.

attributesChanged.text: The ITS-SU shall ignore the security credentials for
The ITS-SU shall reject the security credentials for any certificate whose trust has been revoked by the CCMS.

children.heading: Device enrolment information
children.text:
The ITS-SU shall enrol in the CCMS as required by the relevant enrolment policies.

NOTE: This will allow the ITS-SU to obtain valid credentials from a credential management service.

attributesChanged.text:
The METR distribution system shall enroll in the CCMS as required by the relevant enrollment policies.

NOTE: This will allow the system to obtain valid credentials from a credential management service.

The ITS station shall enroll in the CCMS as required by the relevant enrollment policies.

NOTE: This will allow the system to obtain valid credentials from a credential management service.

attributesChanged.heading: Device enrollment information
attributesChanged.text:
The ITS-SU shall enroll in the CCMS as required by the relevant enrollment policies.

NOTE: This will allow the ITS-SU to obtain valid credentials from a credential management service.

children.heading: Misbehaviour report
children.text:
The ITS-SU shall notify the CCMS of any detected misbehaviour according to the CCMS misbehaviour policies.

NOTE: The detected behaviour can include potential security issues encountered in processing messages, including message authentication or integrity failures, plausibility failures, or other issues appropriate to the CCMS' misbehaviour policies.

attributesChanged.text: The ITS-SU shall notify the CCMS of any misbehaviour detected.

The ITS-SU shall notify the CCMS of any misbehaviour detected.

NOTE:

The ITS-SU shall notify the CCMS of any detected misbehaviour according to the CCMS misbehaviour policies.

NOTE: The detected behaviour can include potential security issues encountered in processing messages, including message authentication or integrity failures, plausibility failures, or other issues appropriate to the CCMS' misbehavior policies.

The ITS-SU shall notify the CCMS of any detected misbehaviour according to the CCMS misbehaviour policies.

NOTE: The detected behaviour can include potential security issues encountered in processing messages, including message authentication or integrity failures, plausibility failures, or other issues appropriate to the CCMS' misbehavior policies.

children.heading: Security credentials
children.text:
The ITS-SU shall maintain the security information necessary to ensure the privacy, integrity, and authenticity of its data transmissions.

NOTE: This includes certificates with associated public and private verifying/signing and encrypting/decrypting keys.

attributesChanged.text: The ITS-SU shall maintain

The ITS-SU shall maintain the security information necessary to ensure the privacy, integrity, and authenticability of its data transmissions.

NOTE: This includes certificates with associated public and private verifying/signing and encrypting/decrypting keys.
